Constructor Detail

TreeUtil

Method Detail

maxDepth

public static <T> int maxDepth(Tree<T> tree)
Compute (1+) the maximum depth of the given tree (0-based).

The depth of a null tree is 0; the depth of a tree with only a root and no children is 1; etc.

treesAtDepth

public static <T> java.util.List<Tree<T>> treesAtDepth(Tree<T> node,
                                                       int depth)
Return all trees at the given depth (0-based) from the given node, where the root is depth 0, the next level down is depth 1, and so on.

Returns:
the nodes at the specified depth (possibly empty, but not null).

prettyPrint

public static <T> java.lang.String prettyPrint(Tree<T> tree)
Graphically display the tree hierarchy using depth first traversal , as the pstree commands does

author Abe Sanderson

Parameters:
tree - The tree to print
Returns:
the graphical string representing the tree

findCommonTrunkPath

public static <T> Tree<T> findCommonTrunkPath(Tree<T> tree1,
                                              Tree<T> tree2)
Find the trunk to branch structure that both trees share

author Abe Sanderson

Returns:
the portion of the first tree which the elements within the second tree share, or null if they do not share any
